metadata.title: CVE-2023-1295 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
A time-of-check to time-of-use issue exists in io_uring subsystem'sIORING_OP_CLOSE operation in the Linux kernel's versions 5.6 - 5.11(inclusive), which allows a local user to elevate their privileges to root.Introduced in b5dba59e0cf7e2cc4d3b3b1ac5fe81ddf21959eb, patched in9eac1904d3364254d622bf2c771c4f85cd435fc2, backported to stable in788d0824269bef539fe31a785b1517882eafed93.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1295` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required
